ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HwTch:ref
Subject: Endpoint Protector Issue    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HwTch:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello,

This is the expected behavior as Allow Access if Trusted Device Level 1 will only allow access to the USB over EasyLock.

To see the preexisting files, you can either set the right for USB devices to allow access to be able to access the USB device. In this case, you can allow a specific USB device if needed.

Or from the personal desktop computer, you can include the file to the EasyLock app. EasyLock can be opened manually on computers without Epp client.

Please let me know if you have questions or if you wish to try the above together in a remote connection.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

TextBody:
Hello,

That is impossible because Allow Access if Trusted Device Level 1+ is designed to block the USB device and install the EasyLock app.
Alternatively, you can allow access to the USB device and install EasyLock from the Epp app.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Subject: RE: Endpoint Protector Issue [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HwTch:ref ]


Hello,

This is the expected behavior as Allow Access if Trusted Device Level 1 will only allow access to the USB over EasyLock.

To see the preexisting files, you can either set the right for USB devices to allow access to be able to access the USB device. In this case, you can allow a specific USB device if needed.

Or from the personal desktop computer, you can include the file to the EasyLock app. EasyLock can be opened manually on computers without Epp client.

Please let me know if you have questions or if you wish to try the above together in a remote connection.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector
